Hears this sort of: Once, the Buddha was in the vihÄra of ÅšrÄvastÄ«. At that time, there was a king named
Prasenajit. At night, he dreamed of ten things:
First, he dreamed of three cauldrons. The cauldrons on both sides had boiling vapor coming and going, but it did not enter the empty cauldron in the center.
Second, the king dreamed of a horse eating with its mouth and also eating with its hindquarters.
Third, he saw a large tree growing flowers.
Fourth, he saw a small tree growing fruit.
Fifth, he saw a person cutting a rope, and behind the person was a sheep, with the sheep's master eating the rope.
Sixth, he saw barbarians sitting on golden and silver couches, eating from golden and silver vessels.
Seventh, he saw a large cow mother suckling from her calf.
Eighth, he saw a herd of cows running and coming from the four directions, mooing and about to fight, but when they were about to join, they did not know where the cows were.
Ninth, seeing a large pond with muddy water in the center and clear water on the four sides.
Tenth, seeing the water in the ravine is completely red.
The king saw these dreams and woke up in fear, worried about losing his country and his own life.
The next day, he summoned his left and right ministers and various non-Buddhist practitioners:
I had ten dreams last night. Who can interpret them?
A non-Buddhist practitioner said:
I can interpret them, but I'm afraid the king will not be happy to hear them.
The king said:
Speak as you know it.
The non-Buddhist practitioner said:
The king will lose his country and his own life.
The king was greatly shocked and frightened. The non-Buddhist practitioner said:
It can be avoided. You should kill your crown prince and your beloved wife, and burn all your treasures to make offerings to the heavens. If the king can do this, he may avoid other calamities.
The king, hearing the words of the mendicant, became worried, startled, and anxious. He returned to the meditation chamber and pondered this matter.
The king had a chief consort named MÄlinÄ«, who came to the meditation chamber and asked:
Why did the king enter the meditation chamber in the daytime, with an uneven complexion and such worry? Who has offended the king?
The king replied:
Do not ask about this matter. It is only your fear and timidity, not something you should know.
The chief consort said:
I am the king's body. We should inform each other of any difficulties.
The king then told the chief consort:
Last night I dreamed of ten things. I asked the mendicant to interpret the dream like this. I am very frightened and do not know whom to tell.
The chief consort said:

Do not worry. It is like someone buying gold. Only when it is polished on a stone can one see if it is good or bad. Now the Buddha is nearby in the monastery. You can go ask the Buddha, and all the calamities and strange occurrences can be known.
The king the next day immediately summoned several thousand of his left and right wise ministers, who came to where the Buddha was, bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet, and the king said:
I had ten dreams last night, I wish the Buddha would explain them for me.
The Buddha told the king:
Be careful not to worry!
What the king dreamed is a manifestation of changes in the future.

The Buddha said:ğŸ”½The king dreamed of three cauldrons, with the steam from the boiling cauldrons on both sides coming and going, not entering the empty cauldron in the center, later generations of people will no longer provide for the poor, relatives, and orphans, the two rich will give gifts to each other, the king's dream of this one thing is exactly this.

The king dreamed of a horse eating with its mouth and also eating with its buttocks, later generations of great ministers and officials will receive salary from the government and also eat from the people, the crooked and straight will also eat, the king's dream of these two things is exactly this.

The king's dream of a large tree bearing flowers means that in the future people will have white hair on their heads before they are thirty years old. The king's dream of these three things is precisely about this.ğŸ”½The king's dream of a small tree bearing fruit means that in the future women will get married and have children before they are fifteen years old, and will be shameless. The king's dream of these four things is precisely about this.

The king's dream of a person cutting a rope while a sheep behind them eats the rope means that in the future when a husband is away on duty or on a business trip, his wife will have an affair with another man behind his back and spend his money. The king's dream of these five things is precisely about this.

The king's dream of barbarians on golden and silver beds eating from golden and silver vessels - in later generations, the noble will be treated as lowly and the lowly as noble. Sitting on high, eating heavy flavors, the gentleman will eat bran and chaff, while the petty man will eat glutinous rice. The king's dream of six things is precisely this.

The king's dream of a large ox sucking milk from its calf - in later generations, mothers will act as matchmakers for their daughters, bringing other men to share the same room with their daughters. The mother will guard the door, collect money and goods, and use them to support herself. The king's dream of seven things is precisely this.

The king dreamed of a herd of cattle running and mooing from the four directions, about to fight and merge, but not knowing where the cattle were. In the future, people will be greedy for sex and keep many wives. The king, ministers, and elders will all greatly rejoice. It will be like this in the present and future worlds. In an instant, the clouds will disperse. At that time, looking back at the strange events, it is intended to make people fear the prohibitions of heaven and earth, understand, and no longer be greedy for sex. Guarding one's wife with a compassionate mind, eliminating the harm of wives. The king's dream of eight things is precisely for this reason.

The king dreamed of a large pond, with the water turbid in the center and clear on the four sides. In the future, people in the country will not respect the elders, but will respect the young people in the border countries. The king's dream of nine things is precisely for this reason.

Your Majesty's dream of a large valley with water running straight red means that in later generations, people, ministers, and officials will be insatiable in their desires, raise troops, gather crowds, attack each other, and kill the people, with blood flowing straight red. Your Majesty's ten dreams are precisely about this.
Your Majesty, do not be afraid, do not be afraid!
There will be no harm to the country, to yourself, or to your wife and children. These dreams are all about future events to come.
The king then knelt for a long time and said:

Having received the Buddha's teachings, my mind is overjoyed, like a person holding a small vessel to receive oil, with much oil and a small vessel, seeking a larger vessel, obtaining a large vessel and pouring it in, immediately feeling at ease and fearless.
The king then bowed twice, touching his head to the Buddha's feet, and left.
Returning to the palace, he bestowed rewards on the principal wife, took away the salaries of the various officials and ministers, and no longer believed the words of the brahmins.
